title: Sync/PurchaseOrder/PurchaseOrders
description:
Any change in the header or the line of the PurchaseOrders will lead to a new timestamp value in both the header and the line. The API will return both header and line data in the same API call, to determine if the record is the header or the line, the line number can be used. If the line number is 0 it is the purchase order header, if the line number is 1 or higher it is a purchase order line.
The sync api's have the goal to keep the data between Exact Online and a 3rd party application the same.
The sync api's are all based on row versioning and because of that it is guaranteed to be unique. Every time an existing record is changed or a new record is inserted, the row versioning value is higher than the highest available value at that time. When retrieving records via these api's also a timestamp value is returned. The highest timestamp value of the records returned should be stored on client side. Next time records are retrieved, the timestamp value stored on client side should be provided as parameter. The api will then return only the new and changed records. Using this method is more reliable than using modified date, since it can happen that multiple records have the same modified date and therefore same record can be returned more than once. This will not happen when using timestamp.
The sync api's are also developed to give best performance when retrieving records. Because of performance and the intended purpose of the api's, only the timestamp field is allowed as parameter.
The single and bulk api’s are designed for a different purpose. They provide ability to retrieve specific record or a set of records which meet certain conditions.
In case the division is moved to another database in Exact Online the timestamp values will be reset. Therefore, after a division is moved all data needs to be synchronized again in order to get the new timestamp values. To see if a division was moved, the /api/v1/{division}/system/Divisions can be used. The property DivisionMoveDate indicated at which date a division was moved and this date can be used to determine if it is needed to synchronize all data again.
The API has two important key fields, the Timestamp and the ID. The ID should be used to uniquely identify the record and will never change
. The Timestamp is used to get new or changed records in an efficient way and will change for every change made to the record.
The timestamp value returned has no relation with actual date or time. As such it cannot be converted to a date\time value. The timestamp is a rowversion value.
When you use the sync or delete api for the first time for a particular division, filter on timestamp greater than 1.
Note: This endpoint does not support query { $select=* } since there are a lot of properties in this endpoint.
This endpoint is available for the following packages:
• Manufacturing (All)
• Professional Services (Advanced & Premium only)
• Wholesale & Distribution (All)

AmountDC.description: Amount in the default currency of the company

AmountFC.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction

ApprovalStatus.description: Approval status of purchase order. 0=Awaiting approval, 1=Automatically, 2=Approved. Approve a new purchase order by giving value 2 if user has PurchaseOrderApproval right.

Approver.description: User who approved the purchase order

DeliveryContactPersonFullName.description: Name of the contact person of the customer who will receive delivered goods

Document.description: Document that is manually linked to the purchase order

DropShipment.description: Shows if it is a drop shipment purchase order

ExchangeRate.description: The exchange rate between the invoice currency and the default currency of the division.

Expense.description: Expense related to the Work Breakdown Structure of the selected project. Only available with a professional service license

ExpenseDescription.description: Description of expense. Only available with a professional service license

IncotermVersion.description: Version of Incoterm  Supported version for Incoterms : 2010, 2020

InvoicedQuantity.description: Quantity of item that has been invoiced

IsBatchNumberItem.description: Indicates that an Item is an batch item

IsSerialNumberItem.description: Indicates that an Item is an serial item

Item.description: Reference to the item for purchase order

ItemDivisable.description: Indicates if fractional quantities of the item can be used, for example quantity = 0.4

NetPrice.description: The net price is the unit price (VAT code taken into account) with any discount applied

OrderNumber.description: Human readable id of the purchase order

PaymentCondition.description: The payment condition code used for due date and discount calculation

Project.description: Reference to project. Only available with a professional service license

ProjectCode.description: Project code. Only available with a professional service license

ProjectDescription.description: Description of the project. Only available with a professional service license

PurchaseOrderID.description: The Purchase OrderID identifies the purchase order. All the lines of a purchase order have the same Purchase Order ID

QuantityInPurchaseUnits.description: Quantity in purchase units. Use this field when creating a purchase order

Rebill.description: Indicates whether the purchase order line needs to be rebilled. Only available with a professional service license

ReceiptDate.description: This field shows the date the goods are expected to be received.

Remarks.description: Include any relevant remarks regarding the purchase order.

SalesOrder.description: Reference to sales order when purchase order generated via back to back sales order. Show NULL if more than one sales order is linked to the purchase order.

SalesOrderLine.description: Sales order line of the sales order that Is linked to a back to back sales order in purchase order. Show NULL if more than one sales order is linked to the purchase order line.

SalesOrderLineNumber.description: Number of the sales order line. Show NULL if more than one sales order is linked to the purchase order line.

SalesOrderNumber.description: Number of the sales order. Show NULL if more than one sales order is linked to the purchase order line.

SelectionCode.description: ID of selection code. Only supported by the Plus, Professional and Premium for Wholesale & Distribution and Manufacturing

Source.description: This shows how the purchase order was created: 1-Manual entry, 2-Import, 3-Other, 4-Purchase order, 5-Sales order, 6-Supplier's items, 7-Subcontract, 8-Purchase order advice, 9-Shop order, 10-MRP calculation, 11-Rest API, 12-Merge purchase orders

SupplierContactPersonFullName.description: Contact person full name of supplier

SupplierItemCode.description: Code the supplier uses for this item

SupplierItemCopyRemarks.description: Indicate if the notes content should be copied from SupplierItem's remarks. The default follows the CopyRemarks value from SupplierItem. Values: 0 = Do not copy remark, 1 = Copy remark

VATAmount.description: Total VAT amount in the currency of the transaction

VATCode.description: The VAT code used when the invoice was registered

VATPercentage.description: The VAT percentage of the VAT code. This is the percentage at the moment the invoice is created. It's also used by the default calculation of VAT amounts and VAT base amounts

YourRef.description: The reference number of the customer
